body.p:
Madisonville Kentucky
May 7th 1864
Governor Thos. E. Bramlette
Dear Sir

Some time since I sent you a petition requesting your Excellency to remit a fine imposed upon me as surity upon a forfeited recognisance before the Hopkins Circuit Court. I desire to know if the petition was received & hope that it was that you may see proper to grant the prayer of myself & friends

The fine is only one hundred Dollars yet it is a large Sum for me to have to pay for no violation of law. I delivered the man up into the custody of the Hopkins Circuit Court its officers & believed that I had then discharged my bond.- I would be pleased to know if my petition had been received and Considered by you & hope that you may see proper to remit the fine- Very Respectfully

John. P. Price
Madisonville
Hopkins County Ky

Hopkins Cir Ct
vs
J.P. Price
$100.
Forfeiture
13th May/64

Remit except
fees & costs
Thos E Bramlette
